data.question: What is the critical pore size distribution range for high-performance metal–organic framework adsorbents for acetylene storage and separation?
What strategy was used to partition the 1D hexagonal channels of the MIL-88 architecture?
data.answer: A precise pore space partition approach

data.question: What is the C2H2 uptake capacity of the optimized SNNU-27-Fe material under ambient conditions?
Why is acetylene storage and separation particularly important in the industry?
data.answer: Due to acetylene's inflammable and explosive nature and its use as a common raw material for numerous chemical processes

data.question: How do high-density hydrogen-bonding acceptors within MOFs contribute to acetylene storage and separation?
data.answer: They serve as high-density H-bonding acceptors for C2H2, offering a good combination of high C2H2/CO2 adsorption selectivity and high C2H2 uptake capacity

data.question: Is the C2H2/CO2 dynamic breakthrough time of SNNU-27-Fe under ambient conditions longer than 90 minutes?
Do all MOFs exhibit moderate CO2 adsorption performance?
Does the introduction of tetrazole groups in MOFs significantly enhance the stability of MOF frameworks?
Is the C2H2 uptake capacity of SNNU-27-Mn higher than SNNU-26-Mn?
Does the pore size of MOFs directly correlate with their C2H2 uptake capacity?
Are the PXRD patterns of SNNU-27 materials unchanged after soaking in various organic solvents and aqueous solutions?
Do larger pore sizes (> 7.5 c) primarily help to enhance C2H2/CO2 selectivity?
What is the role of bare tetrazole N sites in the target MOFs?
data.answer: They act as hydrogen-bonding acceptors to selectively bind C2H2 over CO2 molecules

data.question: What is the effect of metal valences on MOF framework charges and C2H2 adsorption performance?
data.answer: Metal valences can change MOF framework charges, affecting the C2H2 adsorption performance, with certain metal combinations leading to higher C2H2 uptakes

data.question: What is the significance of the pore space partition (PSP) strategy in the development of MOFs?
data.answer: The PSP strategy allows for the precise partitioning of 1D channels into small finite segments with controlled pore sizes, contributing to the optimization of C2H2 uptake capacity and C2H2/CO2 separation

data.question: What is the general framework formula of the designed MOFs?
What is the impact of incorporating strong adsorption binding sites into MOFs?
data.answer: It promotes extra-high C2H2 uptake capacities around 200 cm3 g@1 at 1 bar and 298 K

data.question: Do SNNU-26–29 MOFs all demonstrate typical type-I adsorption isotherms of microporous materials?
What is the BET surface area of SNNU-27-Mn/Co?
Does the introduction of TPP as the C3-symmetric pore partitioning agent result in the continuous hexagonal channels being partitioned into numerous finite segments?
